alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 8:29PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hillsborough, central Belknap and central Merrimack Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 828 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Canterbury, or 8 miles northwest of Concord, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Concord, Laconia, Franklin, Henniker, Hooksett, Hopkinton, Loudon, Barnstead, Epsom, Gilmanton, Canterbury, Weare, Warner, Deering, Bow, Belmont, Gilford, Allenstown, Boscawen and Dunbarton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 0 and 17. Interstate 93 between mile markers 30 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Belknap; Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough
